results.description:
Hi,

The Korean Town (KTown) Meetup is dedicated to building real social community in Korea Town, Manhattan, New York. 

Did you ever want lots of people to explore Korea Town with, but never had the time or organization in order to get 15 or more of your friends together for a night out on KTown.  The Korea Town Meetup is for people interested in exploring Korea Town together and is hosted by a veteran Korea Towner who entertains visitors from Asia, in KTown, frequently.

IMPORTANT NOTE:  China Town and Korea Town in Manhattan have been losing a lot of local Asian businesses.  Asian Americans aren't spending their money in Asian American neighborhoods.  Become a member of the KTown Meetup and contribute to saving Korea Town.   Contribute and build what is a nice, unique community in New York.  If you don't take the time to appreciate nice things when they are there, they might go away. 


Be a force in the fun and prosperity of Korea Town!

Thank you,

The Ski and Snowboard of New York Meetup

This is a small, select group of entrepreneurial and open-minded new or experienced small business owners who want to take their businesses to the next level in a supportive, friendly and sharing environment. 

The intention is that this group would be limited to no more than 10-15 people from a VARIETY of businesses who are committed to meeting once per month in a neutral, rotating location (Brooklyn and/or Manhattan, based on location of members) to share ideas, give honest and open feedback, share best practices, support one another, and help one another learn and grow their businesses!


I expect the meetings would be a mix of structured and unstructured discussion.  Note:  This is NOT a networking group, referrals among the group are NOT expected, and there is absolutely no pressure to share business.  The intention is to share ideas and best practices in a supportive environment!  Solicitation is prohibited, and anyone who does not respect these rules will be asked to leave the group.

topics.name: Be the Change You Wish to See in the World
Your Role in Addressing Climate Change

results.description:
Wondering what YOU can do about climate change? Join the thousands of Citizens Climate Lobby members who are actually moving Congress toward bold climate solutions that could change everything.
CCL will change the way you think about democracy. We're not about marches and protests-- we're about you talking directly to your Senators, Congressmen and their top advisers. If you want to make real change happen, this is an incredibly effective form of advocacy. You will be amazed at how much power you have as an informed and inspired citizen.
There are lots of ways you can inform and influence your members of Congress-- through letters, emails, phone calls, newspaper articles, and through live meetings with your Congressman, Senators and their advisers. We'll teach you how to do any or all of the above-- wherever your comfort zone takes you. And we'll inspire you to maximize your effectiveness as an advocate for real climate solutions.
Best of all, we have a plan and a solid climate proposal for Congress that's actually gaining bipartisan support on Capitol Hill. It is non-partisan, politically viable, scientifically sound, and economically feasible. Economists say it is the most cost efficient approach. Scientists say it is our best shot at saving the planet.
We think New York area citizens deserve a special seat at the table when climate change is being discussed because when it comes to climate impacts and sea-level rise, they have a lot at stake. So we are focused on uniting New York area  citizens this year. We already have established local CCL chapters in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens/Nassau, Staten Island, Long Island, Westchester, and Columbia counties in NY, as well as Albany, Buffalo, Ithaca, Red Hook, Rochester, Syracuse, and Utica, NY, in Fairfield County in Connecticut, and in Central New Jersey.
Join us for an introductory conference call or New York Area Local meeting near you!
Website info: http://www.CitizensClimateLobby.com
What does climate scientist Dr. James Hansen say about CCL?"Most impressive is the work of the Citizens Climate Lobby, a relatively new, fast-growing, nonpartisan, nonprofit group with [193] chapters across the United States and Canada. If you want to join the fight to save the planet, to save creation for your grandchildren, there is no more effective step you could take than becoming an active member of this group."
Register with Citizens' Climate Lobby to learn even more and or join us at a meetup event.

VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: Don't let a very-low RSVP sign up number on the Meet-Up site discourage you from attending. The call is advertised in other places nation-wide. People who are already members attend local meetings and may not RSVP to the meetings listed on meetup.
results.name: New York Area Citizens' Climate Lobby

results.description:
The purpose of this meet up is to help us:

a) better understand the craft of writing and its challenges and rewards; this means discussing theory, psychology, personal experiences, maybe even books!  p:

b) sit down and write!

YOU: 

You're good at writing (or so you've been told), or maybe you're a one hit wonder (that time you wrote that really good poem in middle school!). If you're bold enough to call yourself a writer, you just might be one. For some reason, however, you just can't seem to put that novel together. For some reason, your poems just...well, they don't make your blood flow the way they used to. You keep jumping medium to medium; you started with a novel about your dad's psychosis and now you've decided maybe a TV series on gentrification might be better.

You need new energy, new resolve. Just a little something to bring you to the edge and push you into the deepest depths of writer's waters... 

US:

What we'll do at the meetings is talk about our work/backgrounds/projects and then proceed to write for an hour to hour and a half, and then perhaps we'll each share for a few minutes and get some feedback and/or answer pointed questions by the speaker about their own work. ALL TYPES/NON-TYPES OF WRITERS WELCOME! Location TBD but tentatively Fair Weather Bushwick at 274 Wyckoff Ave; ideally we'd each buy a tea or whatever for using the space! 

Just as much as writing, this group is about friendship! Understanding each others' struggles as writers can in turn make us better writers ourselves. Committed attendance is highly encouraged. 

There will be a $1 fee to cover organizer dues. An envelope will go around at the end of each meet...
results.name: Bushwick Writers Meetup

results.description:
Please note, I do offer personal training services for one on one and partner work sessions. Additionally I offer in home training services if you have a fitness facility in your apartment building or house. Contact me for details.

Hi and welcome to my meetup for outdoor personal group fitness training. This group is open to anyone who is interested in improving their fitness, losing weight, getting stronger and becoming more flexible. My classes are primarily focused on quality, not quantity meaning I'm looking for proper form and technique while using full range of motion. Each exercise circuit is timed to ensure everyone goes at their own pace. I also use progression and regression methods based on fitness levels to ensure you are getting to most out your workout. I don't like to call my class boot camp because it sounds like a hard core, going all out until you puke class. Rather, I like to call it personal group training because its intimate in size and I can give the small groups of 10 or less individualized attention. Its like having a personal trainer for a fraction of the cost!
results.name: LYFT group fitness training of White Plains

results.description:
This group is for nice people who have an interest and/or experience in Thai/kick boxing. Meetups will involve mostly: stretching, warm-ups, skipping rope, work on focus pads, and light sparring. I (the founder of this group) have very modest martial arts experience (a few years of karate, and a year of thai boxing) from many years ago. I’m starting this group in the hopes of gathering a few friendly people with varying skill levels to teach and motivate each other. To test our skills and their effectiveness. When the weather is fine, we meet in Central Park just off Central Park West and 87th Street; in the colder months, we meet at studio spaces, and locations are announced one or two days prior to each session. Join us!*

*PLEASE NOTE: This is a fun and friendly training environment. However, given the intense physical nature of our activities, injuries will occur from time to time. THE ORGANIZERS OF THIS GROUP ARE IN NO WAY RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY INJURIES THAT MIGHT OCCUR.

*RULES OF ENGAGEMENT* When sparring we adhere to the common 50%, 2/3rds strength when sparring that is common practice in many dojos and camps. If you wish to engage hard, communicate with your partner beforehand so you both are on the same page. We are here to test each other and test ourselves, learn from each other and ultimately learn about ourselves. Strength is not just how hard you can punch, but having discipline and control as well. Kob kun krab!

results.description:
Public transit has the potential to be awesome, moving us around our city quickly and easily. But sometimes it really sucks. Buses are never on time, routes can be unfamiliar, and connections are difficult. On the other hand, taxis are too expensive, hard to find and there is no easy way to share a ride with other users.

The latest evolutions in transportation provide enough data to plan and develop new mobile apps, where no operative intervention of dispatchers (or other external agents) is required. Local companies such as Uber, Lyft or Sidecar (among other ride and car sharing, and taxi apps -Hailo, TaxiMagic, Flywheel, Blablacar, MyTaxi) are opening a window into a new relationship between cars and passengers, bringing a closer and more immediate response to a much more personalized transportation.

Let's work together to shape the future of urban mobility and use data/technology/design to make it real.

I'd like to build a community of transit nerds, developers and designers to contribute to the future of urban transportation and take it new directions so it can serve more riders in new and unexpected ways. I can't do it alone, so together let's drag public transit, paratransit and taxicab into the 21st century.
results.name: Future of Urban Transportation - NY

results.description:
Dharma Voices for Animals (DVA) is an organization of those committed both to practicing the teachings of the Buddha (the Dharma) and to speaking out when animal suffering is supported by the actions of those in Dharma communities and by the policies of Dharma centers. We want to be the voice of the animals who cannot speak our language and are unable to ask, “Why are you paying people to do this to me?” or “Why are you supporting my suffering?” We want to support those who are willing to speak out about the harm we cause other sentient beings when we eat them, use their body parts as clothing and in other ways, or use household and personal hygiene products that are tested on animals. While DVA recognizes the challenges of living in a complex, modern society, we wish to promote the choices that provide the greatest reduction of animal suffering. It is our intention to be inclusive in honoring the different views of those who sincerely intend to minimize the suffering of animals.

You are welcome to attend a variety of events when you join the DVA New York Chapter meetup.  In addition to this group we invite you to support our efforts by visiting the website:

http://dharmavoicesforanimals.org/

May all living beings be happy and free!


Our Leadership Team:

Bob Isaacson is the President of Dharma Voices for Animals.  He has practiced the Dharma for nineteen years in the Vipassana/Theravada tradition, and taught numerous classes and retreats.   Bob is also a former human rights and civil rights attorney.  He enjoys hiking, biking, swimming, and world travel.

Kamil Ghoshal is the DVA New York Chapter Leader and dedicated Eight-Precept (aṭṭha-sīla) Theravādin disciple (upāsaka) at the Original Buddhism Society.  He is an aspiring Buddhist scholar with background in Western Philosophy.  Kamil's mission outside of DVA is to help restore the original presectarian Teachings of the historical Buddha, Siddhāttha Gotama.  He is also a mountaineer and traditional Chinese kung-fu practitioner.
results.name: Dharma Voices for Animals - New York Chapter

results.description:
This group is here to connect you to other tennis players that play on a similar skill level and live close enough to get a match in, even with your busy schedule.

This is not a group for finding personal lessons or instructors, it's a group for people that are looking for a good singles or doubles match up. How this works:

1. Create or Join a Meetup: Specify if looking for doubles/singles and your skill level (see below)
2. Once you have enough people for a game, coordinate with them on time, location, and court reservations 

Your next move: Use the message board and meetup schedule to find match-ups near you!

Need your help: Please message me if you want to be able to post Meetups, and I can grant you that access.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Skill Levels:


1.0: This player is Just starting to play tennis.

1.5: Has limited experience and is still working primarily on getting the ball into play.

2.0: Has obvious stroke weaknesses but is familiar with basic positions for singles and doubles play.

2.5: Can sustain a short rally of slow pace with other players of the same ability.

3.0: Fairly consistent when hitting medium-paced shots, but is not comfortable with all strokes and lacks execution when trying for directional control, depth or power.

3.5: Has achieved improved stroke dependability with directional control on moderate shots, but still lacks depth and variety. Starting to exhibit more aggressive net play.

4.0: Has dependable strokes, including directional control and depth on both forehand and backhand sides on moderate shots, plus the ability to use lobs, overheads, approach shots and volleys with some success.

4.5: Starting to master the use of power and spins and beginning to handle pace, has sound footwork, can control depth of shots and is beginning to vary game plan according to opponents.

5.0: Has good shot anticipation and frequently has an outstanding shot or exceptional consistency around which a game may be structured.

5.5: Can vary strategies and styles of play in a competitive situation and hit dependable shots in a stress situation.

6.0: has obtained a sectional and /or national ranking.

6.5: has extensive satellite tournament experience.

7.0: makes his living from tournament prize money.


-----------------------------------------------------------------
New York City Courts:

Central Park: Central Park 93d St. near West Drive

Brian Watkins Tennis Center: East River Park, At Houston St. (walk east over FDR Drive)

Washington Market Park: Chambers St. & West St.

Hudson River Park: Near W 10th St on the Hudson River
results.name: NYC Tennis Match-up

topics.name: Studying for the Graduate Record Exam

results.description:
Do you need to refresh your math for college algebra, the GRE, the GMAT, or just for work and life? Are you going back to school after years in the working world?

I'm here to help! This group meets Sundays at 55 Broad Street (4/5 to Wall St or 2/3 to Wall St). Each 1.5 hour session includes some of the following topics:

Algebra
Word Problems
Elementary Number Theory (Odds, Evens, Primes)
Probability
Geometry
Fractions, Decimals, Repeating Decimals
Percents and Compound Interest This is not a test prep class, but would be very effective if taken concurrently with a test prep class, or prior to beginning your GRE/GMAT studies. (You may also be interested in my other Meetup groups, Unlock the GRE with Perfect Scorer Jen Dziura and Advanced ESL with Jen Dziura.)

I hope to meet you soon!

About Me: I am author, co-author, or editor of many test prep books covering math, vocabulary, grammar, logic, and more. I have developed a series of seminars on "Intellectual Performance Enhancement," covering topics from test stress to the inferential logic common to both verbal reasoning and math problems. I have perfect scores on the GRE and SAT, and a 780 on the GMAT (including perfect 51Q). More importantly, I have helped thousands of students over more than a decade of experience in the test prep world. I explain things clearly (especially to people who have "math terror"), and I'm pretty nice, if I do say so myself! I was the first person in my family to go to college, so I understand the struggles of people who are trying hard to succeed.
results.name: College Algebra / High School Math Refresher with Jen Dziura

A small group of geologists, earth science teachers, students and hobbyists organized the SIGS in 1972 to stimulate interest in mineralogy, geology, paleontology, and the lapidary arts.  The Society has broad activities designed for everyone from beginners to professionals. These activities include illustrated presentations on a wide range of earth science topics, participation in gem and mineral shows and field trips to available collecting areas, both here and in other states. The informal social environment of the Society holds the interest of all ages from the youngest to the oldest. The general meetings are free and open to all who wish to attend. We are also affiliated with the Eastern Federation of Mineralogical and Lapidary Societies (EFMLS) and the American Federation of Mineralogical Societies (AFMS). Meetings are held on the second Friday of the month (September to June) at 7:30 P.M. in the basement meeting room of the Father Hicks Center, St. Clare's School, Lindenwood Road entrance, Great Kills, Staten Island. At each meeting, a speaker presents a talk on their specialized field. Some are skilled hobbyists and others well-known professionals, but all of them bring their specialties to us for our enjoyment.

In order to participate in SIGS field trips, you must be a member in good standing, as our liability insurance will cover you not only to and from the field trips but to and from our meetings on Staten Island, New York as well.

topics.name: "Cloud Computing" How to use it for your business

results.description:
Today's corporate officers and IT technologists are literally deluged with marketing hype over cloud, and the economic advantages of migrating business and IT functions and applications to the cloud. 
• We have seen corporate giants like NetFlix and Sabre (global reservation system used by major airline carriers) experience cloud-based system outages, causing customer delays and significantly impacting business not just in the US, but impacted globally in the case of Sabre.
• There are hundreds of cloud providers to choose from in the market today. Not all are enterprise ready, despite their claims. And let's face it, many have paid or biased positioning in leading independent studies released by highly respected IT research companies. 
• How does a CIO or CTO, and today's CEO, tasked to identify the essential drivers of a business, navigate? Leading independent think tanks (Gartner, Aberdeen, IDC, etc) are not fully equipped to provide battle-tested and deep thorough analysis regarding the critical issues of cloud security, network throughput, reliability and ROI when it comes to enterprise grade customers. Researchers can only convey what they read and disseminate their opinions, not facts. Gartner even has in its disclaimer that all analysis is "opinion and not based on facts." 
• It's time that we get real answers and share actual experiences from companies who are using enterprise grade cloud and from true technologists that has the experience and credentials to provide an unbiased roadmap. 
• GOAL: We create leaner, more efficient companies that is secure, reliable and has the ROI to start training our current employees, and bringing jobs back to the US workforce.
results.name: New York Cloud Computing Meetup

results.description:
We, the organizers of the New York Asian writers Meetup have noticed that many of the language exchange and assistance programs in New York catering to Asians have been based in Manhattan despite that many of the attendees hail from Queens. In addition, we have noticed that most of the language assistance content has been focused on oral communication and reading of non-fiction/short articles in English.

 The organizers of this new meetup hope to bring back the meetings to the local community: Queens. In addition to English speaking and language and cultural exchange, we will also be focusing on writing--both academic and creative (pros/poetry) as well as reading fiction, non-fiction, short essays, articles, excerpts from books, and poems every two weeks. Hopefully, the readings will spark discussion about themes, concepts, ideas and issues relevant the Asia diaspora; Asian American; Pacific Islander and immigrant experience.

 Our target audience is those of Asian descent in NY (Manhattan, Queens, LI, Brooklyn, Staten Island, Bronx, and Queens). Book lovers, writers, and students are encouraged to join our meetings. Whether you are a novice writer, who needs feedback, criticism, or even proof-reading; or an accomplished writer, who would like to see how your writing will be accepted by the public and how people will be impacted by your writing; or a student working on a research paper for school; in all cases, we encourage you to submit your writing and join our meet-up group. Hopefully, these original pieces will also stimulate discussion relevant to diverse Asian communities in NY and the immigrant and international experience that is NYC.

All sorts of writing are encouraged: short stories, poems, articles or essays. There will also be opportunities for peer-to-peer proofreading and also sharing your original writings with the group. There also maybe workshops on how to advance your research skills using our American library system.

 And, finally, we hope to include events and activities that will allow our members to explore the city and get to know each other better. Events such as book readings and signings, dinners, or events at the Asian American Writers Workshop, or visits to interesting but obscure used bookstores, will be included. Our Meetups will be in warm environments like city parks or cafes in Queens. Since we are new, we may change the format as we cater to the ever changing needs of our members.

Important:

 When submitting request to join please upload a real picture of yourself - otherwise your membership will be rejected. Please join us!
results.name: New York English Language Exchange & Asian Writers Meetup

Marble Collegiate Church has been welcoming and affirming of LGBTQ people since 1992, when a small group of gay men who were a part of the Marble community formed GIFTS. We hope you will join us in creating this world through one of our programs and activities!

Marble Collegiate Church is a diverse, inclusive community of God’s people whose faith is led by the life and teachings of Jesus Christ. We welcome, love and empower all persons to become positive thinkers, filled with hope, making a difference in the world. Marble Church is a welcoming and affirming congregation, and worships in the tradition of the Reformed Church in America (formerly Dutch Reformed). 

For more information about the GIFTS Fellowship, its programs and events, or Marble Collegiate Church, please visit us at www.MarbleChurch.org, email us at GIFTS@MarbleChurch.org or call us at 212.686.2770 x260.

- Have the opportunity to work for YOURSELF and grow a full time or part-time income working from home;

-Make your own hours so that you can have more time with your kids, husband, care for elderly relatives, travel, etc.

Then message me your email and I will send you a questionnaire to see if you qualify! Feel free to SHARE this if you know someone who would be PERFECT for this opportunity!

Only 20 spots available so act fast! ONLY SERIOUS applicants please.

results.description:
This is about getting the best Russian spa / sauna treatments in a group of fun people. We plan to have Aromatherapy, Platza (traditional leaves massage) treatment and a lesson, salt scrub, honey mask and more.

If you are a veteran banya-goer who knows how to enjoy steam room and saunas or just want a little adventure trying something uniquely Russian right here in the heart of the city, join us for this experience. Russian baths are tricky to explore on your own (venik technique anyone?) and are best to be done in the mix of experts and neophytes. Lets meet together in one of the Russian baths, learn from each other and enjoy all the banyas have to offer.

Baths events are often associated with gay hookups. While nothing against it in general, don't get confused, this is NOT such an event.

results.description:
Want to lean more about photography from fun, friendly, and professional photography instructors? Want to meet new people, take great photos, and have a ton of fun at the same time? New York Beginner to Advanced Photography Workshops is the group for you!

Our fun and friendly photography group offers classes for all levels of photographers - from the novice who just bought their first camera and can't find the power button, to the seasoned pro who wants to hone their skills and meet new people.   

All of our classes are organized by Remember Forever Photography and include professional instruction from our veteran photographers, and a free course workbook with notes and lessons from class. Best of all, when you sign up through Meetup, all of our classes are half off the retail price!

So grab your camera and bring some friends for a fun and memorable photo experience! We have 5 star reviews on Yelp, Tripadvisor and Travelzoo! Check out our website as well at www.rememberforever.co

Frequently Asked Questions

1.  Help! I can't find my instructor/don't know where we're meeting!

After you sign up for one of our Meetups, you should shortly receive an email from Remember Forever Photography with directions to your meeting spot and contact information for your instructor for the day.  If you don't receive an email from us, give our business office a call at 646.736.3231 and we'll be happy to put you in touch with your instructor, or send you another copy of your confirmation email. Most of our instructors also have the Meetup.com app, so you can send them a direct message as well if you need to.


2. Can I just pay you in cash when I get to class?

Unfortunately, we can't accept cash for tax purposes. Sorry! Most of our instructors can process credit cards on site, but we really appreciate it if you sign up through Meetup first so we get an accurate headcount on who's coming to class.


3. What do I do if it's raining/snowing/hurricaning on the day of my Meetup?

We'll notify everyone by email as soon as possible if we feel we need to cancel a Meetup due to the weather.  If we do need to cancel, we'll automatically reschedule you to the next available Meetup or any Meetup of your choice with equal or lower value.  Check out each individual Meetup for for more info on our refund policy. 


4. Why do you need at least two students enrolled to run a Meetup? And what happens if we don't get enough students signed up. 

Having at least two students per Meetup ensures that we cover the cost of liability insurance for our students and also ensures we can pay our awesome staff photographers a fair wage. 

If we don't have enough students to run a Meetup, we'll notify you as soon as possible and get you signed up for the next available Meetup, or any other Meetup of your choice with equal or lower value. 


5.  I don't see any other students signed up.  Does this mean my Meetup is canceled?

Maybe not! We get students signing up for our courses from several sources in addition to our Meetup group. Unless we notify you otherwise, we more than likely have enough students enrolled to run as scheduled.


Still have questions? Feel free to give us a call at 646.736.3231 or drop us an email at info@rememberforever.co
results.name: New York Beginner to Advanced Photography Workshops

results.description:
At Adventure Nuts we seek the new and unexpected.  We are a tribe of Explorers ready to learn, share and inspire one another through a variety of activities ranging from arts and culture to spiritual awakenings to fitness challenges and everything in between.

Adventure Nuts is primarily funded by Explorer donations and are used to organize and coordinate fun
adventures. We take the interests of our Explorers very seriously and consider their needs, wants and desires when planning the next event. No donation is too big or too small.

At Adventure Nuts we have three core values:

Comradery. We are all explorers part of one tribe. We are all unique and nuts about something. Form a comradely, and get to know the people around you. You will find out that you share more in common than you think!

Be open. This is your time to let go, learn something new, meet new explorers, and inspire one another. You will find that when you embark on an adventure you put your adult responsibilities on hold, and enter into the world of fun and play.

Be curious. Ask questions, share your expertise, and lets all explore together.

Adventure Nuts was started by two friends looking to change the world one adventure at a time. Together we hope to build a tribe of explorers who can learn, share, and inspire one another.
results.name: Adventure Nuts

results.description:
This group is about photographers and models who are from all levels of experience, who are looking to collaborate together to produce some fantastic images.  We are now expanded to MUA's and fashion designers, and hair stylists to make the creative experience a more rewarding one.  Our group will meet once to twice a month; I also run another meet-up group and want to dedicate enough time to both groups.  

The idea is our model members will participate for themed shoots; have their makeup done by our MUA's  while our photographer members will photograph them.  All parties will learn from one another, resulting in some fun diversified images.  We will try our best to match the number of photographers to each model and every model will have the opportunity to get photographed.  Our activities will be non-paying for all sides, but the experience is very rewarding.

[In cases where we do not have model members to model for us, we will have the option of recruiting outside models, which may require $20 per person.  I will do my best to keep that cost as low as possible.]

• Please post your images in a prompt manner and forward a minimum of 5 images so that our model members, and Makeup artists could keep or add to their portfolios. Photographers have one week from the date of our event to to edit and process their pics to be forwarded to each model and makeup artist.  Unless otherwise specified by the Organizers, (Failure to do so, means that you aren't in compliance to our group rules which isn't fair to our models or MUA's and interferes with our exchange.  As a result you will be asked to leave our group, serious artists are required here.). 

 I recommend placing watermarks on all your creative works.  Release forms will be given out to protect the creative works of the photographer and to ensure 5 images for our models and MUA's. (NO OUTSIDE RELEASE FORMS ALLOWED!!!!)

I welcome ideas for great convenient locations where we can take our photographs.   Together we can build up our portfolio's for creative growth and new possibilities.  Our past events have topped the next, and keeping this momentum requires serious artists, and creativity. 

Disclaimer: be mindful of the risks of the weather and travels, all participation is at your own risk.   It is your responsibility to stay up to date with travel changes or delays.  But when I can I will post necessary info. as they become available.

results.description:
GDG Newark was started in 2012 to host a Google I/O Extended. We have recently moved to meetup.com to expand our groups visibility. We currently focus on the Android mobile platform. If you're interested in other Google technologies please join our group and consider hosting a session. 

To visit this page directly just visit GDGNJ.org

Our meetings will always be free and open to the general public. These events will be hosted at the New Jersey Institute of Technology. Surrounded by other colleges and a quick train ride away from Newark Penn Station. 

Disclaimer: GDG New Jersey is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed on here should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation. What is a GDG (As defined by Google)? Google Developer Groups (GDGs) are for developers who are interested in Google's developer technology; everything from the Android, App Engine, and Google Chrome platforms, to product APIs like the Maps API,YouTube API and Google Calendar API. A GDG can take many forms -- from just a few people getting together to watch our latest video, to large gatherings with demos and tech talks, to events like code sprints and hackathons. However, at the core, GDGs are focused on developers and technical content, and the core audience should be developers.
results.name: Google Developer Group Newark, New Jersey

results.description:
Q:   Do you like to stay well-informed on the current events, and enjoy reading and discussing various topics for intellectual stimulation?

A:   Well, you've come to the right place!

The premise is simple: We get together about every three weeks and discuss something interesting based on what the members find compelling in an news article, video segment, or a podcast.  The topics can range from the serious to the inane, but we strive to discuss something that has enriching coverage and deep analysis.  Click here to see a sample of our favorite, but non-exhaustive sources.

Our goal is to provide a friendly forum for people to come in person, sit down at a table for about two hours, and exchange views and discuss ideas over coffee or whatever beverage of their own choosing.  The organizers will keep the discussions open and moving. 

We try to keep meetup sizes relatively small to allow participation and interaction, keeping in mind what the venue will allow. Members can sign up for the waitlist if all the spots fill up. As people with RSVPs cancel, waitlisted members will be moved onto the RSVP list. Organizers will try to reasonably accommodate longstanding members who've had good past attendance as well as members who contribute by the way of an article suggestion or thoughtful comment.

How it works: Each meeting organizers select a theme and an article to go along with it. Members nominate and vote on a second article. All attending members of a meeting are expected to come prepared for discussion by having read both articles.

To encourage members to arrive early so meetings can end on time, we offer a pre-meeting topic. Usually a lighter discussion based on more immediate events. There may be an article attached, but reading of it is not required.

Join us, as we share thoughtful discussions on the topics that interest everyone!
results.name: Café News

results.description:
Hello, Are you interested in Fun Events-Day Trips? Night Trips? Social events? Casual meet-ups? Our group intends on hosting quality, organized, affordable events that will allow you to meet new people, try something different... and have fun while doing it! We are meeting in the NYC Area. In the end, it's not going to matter how many breaths you took, but how many moments took your breath away. So join Us and lets have some FUN! Hopefully see you soon,

Thanks, Robert

results.description:
This is a group for Progressive Muslims in their 20's or 30's looking to meet each other in NY, having light friendly conversation, socializing and connecting. We plan to meet at different venues in NYC, eat out, picnics,day trips, night outs and other adventures. We want to create a meet up for young, active and modern Muslims whether singles, couples or young families who enjoy brunching, dining, sports, outdoor adventures and some nightlife. Please note this is not a religious,social or political discussion group. In fact we will steer clear from such topics and enjoy good company. Non Muslims who fit this profile are welcome to join us as well. 

RSVP YES to events only if you are 100% committed to attending which is only fair considering there is no membership fee for this group and we do not charge event fees either.

Please link the meet up group to an active email ID so emails and messages reach you in timely manner. This group is for ACTIVE members only. INACTIVE members will be removed from group and are welcome to re-join when they are able to participate more actively. ACTIVE members are requested to make an effort to participate in any one event at least once in a year from their date of joining to retain their membership. Our efforts are to create a compact, dynamic group and you should have the time and inclination to attend events. 

Profile picture must include your photo, membership will be declined if anything else is displayed. 

Meetup messaging is an important communication tool for this group, please ensure you are able to access and respond to messages sent by organizers. To access and reply to your messages click on the dialogue icon in top right corner with desktop view of this site or on the dialogue icon at the bottom in the meetup app. We have formed some good friendships in this group. If you want to connect with other members please join us for events. Inappropriate messages and behavior will not be tolerated and such members will be removed from group.

Organizing takes lot of time and effort and therefore we place high premium on members attending events as RSVP'd. Our organizers are offering to organize/host events in their spare time and are equally busy in their lives/careers, so we want to make this a smooth process for everyone. Request all members to note below rules of the group and take a moment before you RSVP. Treat these events as other social events where you are a guest and extend courtesy to the host/event organizer by RSVP'ing carefully. Thank you.

No need to RSVP NO if you are not attending, unless you are changing your RSVP from YES to NO.

RSVP YES to events only if you are 100% committed to attending. RSVP's will be considered FINAL 48 hrs prior to the event, last minute change allowed in certain unavoidable circumstances. Remember that waitlisted members deserve fair opportunity to attend.

Certain premium reserved events as indicated on the event write up will only have Final RSVP, in other words it will be considered no show if you change from YES to NO. 

No shows (members who RSVP YES and do not show up for the event without notice) will be removed from the group and banned from re-joining.

RSVP changes on day of event will not be tolerated with some understandable and reasonable exceptions.

Habitual RSVP changers (members who repeatedly RSVP Yes and change to NO) will be moved to waitlist by default. They may also be charged a meetup fee in advance for attending future events.

Please try to arrive on time for events and use MTA trip planner tool which is useful if you are using public transit for directions, transit changes during weekend and timings.

http://tripplanner.mta.info/mobile/

Feel free to contact with any suggestions for events that you may like to attend or host.

This group is dedicated to helping the solo/small business owner develop his market, brand, communication, etc. 

Have you read a book, taken a class, seen a coach, followed their advice and come up with something that seems great, but there is no way to get feedback without spending a ton of money for more coaching, more classes, etc. that you can't afford?

It happened to me a while back.  I took a great course, but the promised support and feedback wasn't there, and to get feedback and the great ideas I came up with, would have cost me hundreds or thousands of dollars.  Instead of spending all that money, I thought, I could find a group of smart people who could help each other.

If you are interested in getting some feedback for your great ideas?  If you are looking for resources and recommendations?  Join us!

We will meet regularly to brainstorm and exchange ideas how to build our business and to provide support and feedback to each other.  We will explore bringing in coaches and experts to help teach us, and when we do, we can use the Mastermind group to refine what we've learned.

I also hope we can create a great directory of people and resources that can help everyone develop their business.

                    Joel

The world today is ripe with opportunities for all people and this group wants to make sure our participation is equitable. 

The How:

1)we  will meet with  and celebrate those among us who have achieved great things (thought leaders, authors, educators, professionals and everyday folks) to share in their wisdom on how they've done it-and how we can too. 

2) we are creating a revolutionary mentoring system to help us bring each other along faster. 

COME JOIN THE MOVEMENT! Let's get back to being the village that loves and cares for one another! 

P.S. We will have some fun too!

results.description: Hi! :) So I've been in NYC for about 14 yrs now and as much as I still love this place but lately it's been feeling like something has been missing a little here. I've done the bar scene, I've done the intellectual scene, the party scene, the museum scene, etc...And as much as I like pieces of each of those things, but never seem to fit in perfectly to any particular group. So I decided to start a meetup group that was a combination of all of those things...<br> If you've been in NYC for a long time and have been there and done that and you are looking for something more, this is the group for you. If you just got to NYC this is a great way to balance off all the rock star partying you've been doing with seeing what the greatest city on earth has to offer lol:)<br> I want to set up events and fun things to do that are just a little bit more intellectual, just a little more advocacy related, for people who care just a little bit more about life:) If you are passionate and fun, aren't afraid of caring about the world or using your brain while getting shit faced for example, or are always up for an adventure then you are in the right place.<br> Some events will be a little bit more heavier (like our first weeks) and thought provoking and some a little bit more fun and light hearted (like our second weeks). If you ever have suggestions for events, I'm all ears :)

results.description:
Welcome!

Converged Infrastructure New York City group (CINYC) is a forum for gaining awareness and exchanging ideas around practical benefits of convergence of business and technology.  Each one of us is, in some way, focused on bridging the gap between business requirements and the properly structured set of technologies to address such requirements.   We are sensitive to the dichotomy that often exists between various groups in large organizations and we are passionate about taking a collaborative approach to closing such gaps.  We are here to learn, to help each other recognize and reap rewards promised by convergence of infrastructure - a relatively new trend focused on lowering the cost of operating cloud environments by engineering and packaging technology stacks.

See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Converged_infrastructure

We exist to help facilitate meetups where professionals & end-users can share best practices for valuing, deploying and operating CI technologies.  Professionals and experts can become aware of new market needs, and new users can gain practical knowledge, expand their foundations about market trends; everyone can grow their professional network. The collaborative cross-organizational approach to implementing CI and harnessing its benefits encourages sharing of ideas, giving rise to sharing best practices - for everyone’s benefit.

Join us if your areas of interest include business transformation, DevOps, use-cases, lessons learned as part of improved organizational re-alignment, as well as intersections of economics and technology.   We expect to have a good mix of technical and business topics and, naturally, welcome speakers and practitioners.
results.name: Converged Infrastructure NYC

results.description:
Circling is the art of presence and co-discovering our deepest selves in community with each other “in the moment”.

 It’s a practice that allows you to enliven, deepen and richen conversations into experiences of profound empathy and insight. 

It’s a practice that naturally has you building skills in connecting, communication, conflict resolution and understanding others. 

It’s a practice that supports the development of genuine curiosity and appreciation for yourself and others. 

What it looks like is a group of people in a circle with their open, curious attention on one individual “getting circled”. Their intention is to “be with” and “understand” what’s happening for this individual moment by moment as “whatever is happening arises”.

The results, in my experience, are profound visceral connection and a quality of conversation that has people moved, inspired and nourished. In my experience, it also results in a much greater awareness of oneself and others. 

This is a meetup group for those interested in developing skills around or experiencing any of what they read above. 

Members can expect to learn the basics of Circling and to participate in two circles every meet up.
results.name: New York Circling Meetup Group

results.description:
As stutterers, we know how tempting it can be to isolate ourselves from the chaos of city life. We know the fear that bubbles up every time we're asked our name, or need help finding an address, ordering food, or even just meeting an old friend. We go to therapy- some of us for years- spending hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars- trying to free our words. 

Even with every physical skill in the book at our disposal, however,  something's missing.  We're still not convinced we have a right to share, loud and clear, the stories, opinions, and quirks that make us who we are. That's because the key to a full life isn't in the hour-a -week spent in the clinic support group, trying to pour your heart out in the three minutes you have before someone starts getting antsy. Talking about what's going on inside certainly has its place in the therapy process, but lasting change can only come from living loudly- actually going out into the world and communicating, on a regular basis.

That's why I (we ) started NYFS. We're planning on regular ( once a week to two weeks) meetups- some just to hang out, and some structured in such a way that we each face a particular type of communication challenge, with the support of the group behind us. This desensitizes us to the fear of disfluent speech,; the fear of being different.

Examples include:

• Going into a department store and asking where you might find the dinner plates

•  Asking a bus driver for directions as people are getting on ( to help experience time pressure)

•  Placing complicated pizza orders over the phone.

•  Talking to a member of the opposite ( or same) sex that you'd like to get to know better, romantically or otherwise

• Talking to a stranger in the park about what you're doing and what stuttering is exactly ( you'd be surprised at how receptive most people are to it!)

Now, we know that everyone is in a different place with their stuttering. That's why, for the first few weeks, we'll be splitting people into groups based on what they're comfortable with- Easy, Medium, and Difficult challenges. I or another group leader will be available to help talk you through what you're feeling beforehand and to offer support, no matter where you're at.


We ARE NOT  licensed speech pathologists, and don't claim to offer therapy. We just know what de-sensitization has done for us and we hope it can do the same for others, when they're surrounded by friends.


Watch this space, message us with any questions you might have and get ready to be fully you!
results.name: Stutter In the City

results.description:
Through a series of workshops you will get an exclusive opportunity to experience a designer's creative process in a hands-on activity. Alyson will explain how that same design process can be applied to everyone's personal and professional lives (even for the so called design-challenged). All people can be designers in their everyday lives; creating each day one by one. Design training can improve how you react to life's surprises by working with your current resources. After a workshop, you will have a new appreciation of design and a new outlook on your life. 

Alyson Toone is the founder and designer for lifestyle brand, Alyson Jon. Life. She designs and creates each piece of handmade jewelry featuring upcycled wares and natural semi-precious stones. Alyson earned her Bachelor of Fine Arts in Fashion Design from Columbus College of Art and Design in her hometown of Columbus, Ohio. She currently resides in Brooklyn where she is constantly inspired and is always learning. By day, she designs outerwear for children in the Garment District and spends her evenings with her brainchild, Alyson Jon. Life. Visit her website here: http://www.alysonjonlife.com

results.description:
I have formed this group to be a pleasant and relaxing activity alternative and/or supplement to those who fit within the age confines, i.e., 59+ who have invisible physical disabilities. --I'd really prefer that the members are above 59 or above.

 We are and should all be here to lend an ear, as well as "give a listen"to each other, not necessarily being 'yes-men"--but being considerate, and supportive considering our sometimes unique needs and challenges that have become more common within society.
This group is open to calm and friendly communication and camaraderie. We will likely be meeting at public and private spaces to talk, to squawk and to be there for each other.
Eventually, I would like to have (an) assistant organizer(s), and perhaps expand our scope of activities, i.e., going to films, museums, and the like. but we have time for that. As we are a new meet up group, first let's establish the membership.

I look forward to this endeavor.

For future events, I request that you please be sure to RSVP and if you've a mind to cancel and barring an emergency please be kind enough to cancel 24 hours ahead so that the group knows how many people are coming.
results.name: NYC Socializing With Invisible Disabilities 59YO+

Occasionally, we even take in a black-created movie, performance or exhibit.  Suggestions are welcome!

Please note our No-Show policy: Please honor your “Yes” RSVPs by attending.  If you’re not able to attend, please be considerate to your fellow group members, the business owners, and me, and update your RSVP at least 1 day before the scheduled start of the meetup.  If you don’t show, or cancel your RSVP the same day of the event 3 times, you’ll be removed from the group.

Be transparent. This group requires a profile photo to join.  If you don't have a photo of yourself in your avatar, I'll ask you to upload one if you've RSVPd for a meetup, at my discretion. I and the other group members like putting a name to a face!

results.description:
An Ethics Lab is a discussion and support group that meets weekly on Wednesdays at Brooklyn Society for Ethical Culture. We are a separate entity and nobody has to join anything to work with us.

We sit around a big wooden table and we talk about what we want to change about ourselves and what we have to do to make that happen. New habits we want to cultivate. Old habits we want to let go of. Beliefs or reactions we have that are harmful to us and other people. Sometimes we discuss ethics or science or religion.

We decide on goals for ourselves and go to the Ethics Lab to report and for support.

Examples:

Mindfulness meditations. Losing weight. Finding a correct lay monastery to join. Developing your critical faculties by use of formal logic and/or mathematics. Overcoming addictions including addictions to emotions or ideas. Gaining weight. Expressing yourself through artwork. Prayer. Joining a group so you can trick yourself into reinventing yourself. Yoga. Finding a boyfriend or girlfriend. Jogging. Changing careers.

Someone pointed out that we are keeping the art of conversation alive. Yep. With a bit of Socratic method, performance art and good old fashioned magic smoke & mirrors mixed in.

Three examples of the kind of thing I might recommend to someone during a talk at the Ethics Lab.

1. Decide on the thing you want to change in yourself and then only commit to observing yourself as it is happening as the very first step.

2. Taking the time to find out what your thoughts and feelings are about your thoughts and feelings.

3. Understanding that meditating can be whatever you are doing at the moment.

An Ethics Lab is a place where people with different even opposing beliefs meet and learn that we are of value to each other because of those differences. It’s a lab because we see being wrong as an opportunity to learn.

I enjoy witnessing people deciding to change then doing it. I also enjoy telling their stories. I’m a writer so I see the Ethics Lab as a mix of everything from poetry to journalism.

I’ve learned so much from the folks who have sat at the table with me since September of last year. Every account of conscious change I can pass on makes it easier for someone, somewhere.
results.name: Ethics Lab of Brooklyn

If you are an adult sibling of a person with autism who cares and worries about their families, join us! There is strength and support in numbers and you just might enjoy swaaping stories and solutions!

results.description:
NY novelist Arthur Nersesian  is a prolific novelist with more than  ten novels written in the  last fifteen years.  He is offering for the first time an intensive six week workshop in which he will critique each member's work and share with them the secrets of his successful writing career.  The class will meet once a week and be limited to seven writers who have a work in progress and are serious about getting their work published.

In addition to the workshop, Arthur will give talks based on his own personal experiences regarding:

*Conceiving and plotting a work

*Revising a work upon completion, making it sharper, crisper and better

*The daily discipline of writing (and overcoming blocks)

*How to get your work published, some basic business tips

Anyone interested should submit a fiction writing sample of no more than 3000 words (10 pages) in length. Although his expertise is in the novel form, he will consider short stories, screenplays, and plays. Arthur will then conduct an interview with the most qualified candidates. Payment must be made in advance. Only seven seats are available. Feel free to contact Arthur with any questions.

More about the Author:
Arthur has been published by HarperCollins, Simon & Schuster and Akashic Books. Four of his full-length plays were produced Off-off Broadway, and are now published together as East Village Tetralogy. He wrote the screenplay for one of his books, and last year his third book, Dogrun, was made into a major motion picture, directed by Anthony Edwards, and starring Heather Graham and Gina Gershon. His books have been translated into a half a dozen languages. His short stories, essays, poems and reviews have appeared in various books, magazines and journals.

This is an amazing opportunity to learn in an intimate setting the ins and outs of how to get your work published from someone who has actually done it.
results.name: Intensive Writer Workshop with Real NY Novelist

results.description:
Yes, there is canyoneering in the Northeast!  Come join us if you're interested. 

I'm hoping this meetup will help bring together canyoneers across the region and help bring the sport to the Northeast.

-Andre

What's a typical trip like? A typical trip involves hiking/bushwhacking to the top of a water course and following it down by rappelling waterfalls (some over 100'), down-climbing, lots of slippery boulder hopping, and bushwhacking. Swims are possible, deep wading probably, and there's always lots of getting splashed on.

NEC is not a guide or training service. All trips are member organized and you are solely responsible for your own safety.  

All participants must be, at minimum:

• Strong hikers able to navigate off-trail and bushwhack across difficult terrain (scree, unstable slopes, slippery stream beds, boulder fields, etc) with heavy ropes and gear.

• Experienced rappellers able to negotiate challenging rappels with overhangs, loose rocks, water, slippery footing, etc. Having rappelled once or twice is not "experienced".

• Knowledgeable enough to safety check anchors, rigging, knots and each other. 

What about less experienced members?

You can join the meetup, but cannot come on trip without proper training.

NEC is not a guiding or instructional service and does not provide training, but there are a few other options:

1) The best way to get started is to take a 3 day course from a professional instructor in the Zion, Moab, or Los Angeles areas.  Unfortunately there are no instructors on the East Coast. 

2) The second best way is to learn rappelling and anchor building from another sport (like technical caving, ice climbing, mountaineering, and rock climbing). Canyoneering techniques are a little different, but the foundation skills are enough to join most trips. 

In time there will an online resource section to supplement formal training with canyoneering-specific techniques and some informal members-hosted skill building practice sessions.
results.name: Northeast Canyoneering

results.description:
Feminism, ah--a word that carries so much baggage. Let's unearth it. Let's talk street harassment. Let's talk gender. Let's talk theory. Let's talk empowerment. Let's talk love. 

People of all sexes and genders and nonsexes and nongenders from Brooklyn and beyond are welcome.

What is woman?
Are there things about her that escape the conditioned influences of her character?
How do capitalism and patriarchy make sense of this creature?
Is there freedom for woman in patriarchy?
What is the aim of the street harasser and how can we subvert them?
How can we react to oppression--let alone spot it, declare it for what it is?
How can we recognize the oppressor within ourselves?
How is feminism too often racialized?
Hell, what does that word even mean?

Welcome to The Feminist Salon!
results.name: The Feminist Salon

Our family of small business groups has over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing!  

We are a community-led organization supported by its members, who range from students reading business books in their dorm rooms, to entrepreneurs looking to become the next  Bill Gates, to investors in search of the next big thing, to top business experts, to established CEOs at some of New York’s top companies.

Is going into business for you?

If so, enjoy meeting new contacts for networking and be part of the group that brings together a broad range of people thinking about starting a new business. Members include start-up entrepreneurs, experts sharing their knowledge and investors looking for new concepts.

We have many functions such as social networking, interactive lectures, discussions, online meetups, brainstorming sessions, round table meetings, think tanks, experts panels and informative educational webinars.

This group is intended to be an educational think tank that will help you with the elements of conceiving and starting a new business. Our purpose is to support each other in learning, growing and having fun along the way.

Come join us!... Remember in NYC is not what you know, but who you know! 

HOPE TO SEE YOU AT OUR NEXT EVENT!

Organizer: Roger Kuperways, Ph.D. Life long Entrepreneur, investor, and former adjunct Professor of Entrepreneurship at New York University. 

See us on Facebook and on our parent website http://www.businessonashoestring.com

results.description:
We all have an instinctual need for human touch. In this chaotic, individualistic society we live in however, asking for help in fulfilling this most basic, most beautifully human desire has become taboo- a signal of weakness- especially among men. I started this group because I genuinely feel that so many of our ills and traumas could begin to be healed if we allowed ourselves to love and be loved in a completely unselfish, non-sexual way. I hope to host meetups at places like movie theatres, cafes and eventual members' homes, where we sit, hold each other, and talk about whatever might be on our minds. You will learn that it's okay to let other people in, and that it's okay to say no. You'll learn that you are enough and you are loved.
I encourage you, straight or gay, to give this a shot. I know this can change the world, if only we trust in the immense power of physical connection.
results.name: Cuddling Men NYC

For a fixed price, people can access food and drinks that have been expertly curated by yellowchair and their partners, as well as meet like-minded people in a casual dinner setting. It's the perfect experience for food explorers, no-pressure dates and everything in between.

“yellowchair is the ultimate social network for people who love food – and people," says Goldstein.  “Our goal is to create a climate whereby members enrich their social experience with unique, themed food experiences.”

 “Think of it as an innovative version of dinner-with-friends - and new friends," Sandlofer adds. "You don't book a table just for your individual party.  You make a reservation and join other yellowchair members – thereby socializing with like-minded foodies, travelers, tastemakers – and enlarging your circle of acquaintances.”

Friends don't let friends sit in chairs that aren't yellow!

www.yellowchair.com

results.description:
¿Quiénes somos?
En Spanish Expats nuestro objetivo es reunirnos con españoles y español parlantes que tengan una conexion especial con España. Los eventos que organizamos son informales y no pretenden más que el intercambio de experiencias y opiniones por medio de conversaciones y especialmente ampliar el ambito social de sus miembros a traves de actividades conjuntas.

Hemos buscado en Westchester County grupos parecidos a los de las grandes ciudades pero sin suerte. Claro que no nos importaría bajar a la ciudad para reunirnos con otros españoles pero, ¿por qué no formar un grupo aquí en Westchester donde no tengamos que viajar?

Por eso, hemos decidido a crear nuestro propio grupo convencidos de que hay un gran número de personas que seguro que están interesadas en compartir su tiempo con otros españoles con los cuales tienen algo más que la lengua en común. 

 ¿Quiénes NO somos?
No somos un grupo para practicar el idioma, ya que hay muchos otros meet-ups que ofrecen clases y oportunidades para conversar a diferentes niveles. Nuestros miembros ya hablan un español fluido, si no necesariamente nativo, y se sienten comodos expresandose en castellano.

 ¿Cómo apuntarse?
Sólo hace falta apretar el boton de "Join us" que aparece en la página nuestra de Meet-up. Luego contesta las preguntas completamente. Las preguntas son una manera de conocerse al grupo antes de asistir un evento, y son una herramienta importante para el grupo así que es importante contestarlas completamente. Luego nos llegará tu petición y recibiremos un email para aprobarla. Es posible que no aceptemos aplicaciones que no reflejen los objetivos del grupo.

Pertenecer al grupo es gratis y lo único que se requiere es ser educado y respetuoso con todos, así como cooperar en la organización de los eventos de forma que vuestro RSVP realmente refleje si vais a acudir al evento o no.

Gracias por vuestra participacion y esperamos veros pronto...
results.name: Expats españoles en Westchester County, NY

Achelle - #ThriveInThePark is the workout I look forward to all week! Not only do I get an incredible full body workout, but it's a fun and encouraging group to be apart of!

Devon - #ThriveInThePark is the best way to sweat out last night's wine.

results.description: Are you interested in becoming an effective public speaker and improving your listening skills? At $60 for six months it is also one of the most cost-effective skill-building tools available anywhere. Consider joining Harlem Toastmasters. The club is one of the 14,650 clubs of Toastmasters International. Toastmasters clubs operate in 126 countries. Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Members of Toastmasters improve their speaking skills by attending recurring meetings where they deliver speeches or evaluate other speakers. Membership in Toastmasters is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. How Does It Work? A Toastmasters meeting is a learn-by-doing workshop in which participants hone their speaking and leadership skills in a no-pressure atmosphere. There is no instructor in a Toastmasters meeting. Instead, members evaluate one another’s presentations. This feedback process is a key part of the program’s success. Meeting participants also give impromptu talks on assigned topics, conduct meetings and develop skills related to timekeeping, grammar and parliamentary procedure.
results.name: Harlem Toastmasters Meetup

This is a group of people interested in viewing, collecting, discussing, learning and making Art Jewelry, Custom Jewelry, Fine Jewelry Collections, Silversmithing, Goldsmithing and Metalsmithing. 

Every 3rd Sunday a process demonstration will be conducted in the studio at 2:30pm, this will take place during the Hoboken Gallery Walk.  We can exchange information about various techniques used to make jewelry, silversmithing or goldsmithing.  You are welcome to request a technique or do a demonstration of your own. (please set up in advance)

Meetups will be held in my studio at the Monroe Arts Center, art jewelry galleries, museums and other studios or venues that share interest in art jewelry.  

I would like to share information about the art jewelry community, up and coming events, conferences, openings and competitions happening around our community and outside. I would like to create a dialog about topics that include tools, techniques, processes, materials and why we make what we make.  I think we could learn a lot from each other. 

EatMetal, Inc studio includes a gallery space, workbenches for students, a communal workspace and my own personal work space. I will host open houses, events to preview my new fine jewelry collections, one of a kind pieces and small scale sculpture. Guest jewelry artist's will be invited to come and show their work in the gallery.  All level classes are offered in the fall, winter and spring for an 8 week session. The focus is on core fundamentals and honing your skills. Great fun at the studio is Evening or Afternoon One Day Workshops @ EatMetal, Inc. which center on one project and you get to Bring Your Bling Home!  


Look forward to seeing you in the studio!

This group is for any 29+ age careerwomen looking to network and socialize with each other for friendship or casual business networking. We do different ice breaker events, networking and social events at new restaurants, tea houses, wineries, board game nights etc. 

The mission of this group is to enable careerwomen with current, active, ongoing careers to network and socialize with each other in order to educate, emotionally support career women in their careers and in their career-focused lifestyles. It is create a outlet for women to discuss different topics that affect careerwomen every day including individual-specific topics like navigating in your career, overcoming challenges at work, e.g., making alliances with key people in the office-- as well as external factors like the global, national, local business/economy,  the glass ceiling, when will be the first female president.  Whether you are in an ambitious mode or cruising in your job, this is the outlet for you to have a voice about these topics. But do not be fooled - much bantering and jokes are welcome -- we are here to get to know each other.  While networking is encouraged, sales /self marketing is prohibited.

If you are trying to reconnect with new female contacts who are ambitious, intelligent and educated like you, please join us and let's talk shop from female point of view! 

These conversation topics are encouraged: travel, movies, music as well as the intellectual topics like economics, business, finance, even politics and perhaps technology that is ever changing and affecting business.

Group for younger widows/widowers to have support
Social Meeting for Widows and Widowers

results.description:
Soaring Spirits is an organization  run by widowed people, that connects widowed people world wide. Our goal is to give you hope and to let you know that you're not alone. We have Regional Groups all over the US and are starting one here in NYC. It's a social group where we all connect and share. Although our group is open to anyone in the NY/NJ area or anyone who wants to travel for a social event, most of our meet-ups are in Manhattan. Sometimes we meet in other buroughs as well. This is a social hang-out group, not a support group, although we do offer each other plenty of support.  

 We're all inclusive - no matter your age, sex, religion (or lack thereof), sexual preference, relationship status, etc. This is NOT a dating service, it's a place to connect and make friends. We meet 2x per month at local restaurants, parks, beaches, movies, plays, museums, and many other fun events. If you have lost the person you planned on spending the rest of your life with to death, and you'd like to meet other people who "get it", give us a try. Welcome.
results.name: NYC-Area Widows and Widowers Soaring Spirits Group Meetup

topics.name: Small Groups - Book Club, Discuss Issues

results.description:
The Greenwich Library Foreign Affairs Book Club has been providing lively discussions of books focused on foreign affairs, international issues, and US economic and political themes for the last 7+ years. Our core group of 12-15 welcomes all those interested in joining the discussion.

We meet monthly (Sept-June) often on the 3rd Tuesday at the Greenwich Library.  (Check the front desk for to see which meeting room we're in).

Our current members have a variety of experiences and a wealth of personal history and perspective to share from past careers and/or travel.  We've had people come for one topic, never to see them again, and others who have been stalwart attendees from Day 1.

We try to find books that are not too long (300 page targeted maximum), that might appeal to a broader audience (so we can justify the Library buying a few copies), and that are on topics that our readers are looking to explore.  

I've listed the books we've reviewed over the last few years on a page in the Pages section so that you can get a feel for our style.

Feel free to join us to just observe the discussion, or dive right in.
results.name: Greenwich Library Foreign Affairs Book Club

Our main goal is to get outdoors and do the following:

Walking, light- hiking, monthly group gatherings, (ideas welcome for that...)
to include Central Park, Riverside, interesting neighborhoods and hopefully some local "field-trips" to parks with good trails. Our walks will be in the hour to 1 -1/2- hour range. Events will be flexible and open ended. No hiking boots required for our terrain.

I started this group because I enjoy walking the city and I would love sharing it. I would like to meet other people who want to get some exercise and enjoy the city and have some fun conversation along the way. We can then have impromptu social time following our walks at local venues. I will plan after-work weeknight walks in addition to weekends.

If you are looking to meet new friends, enjoy the great weather after our long winter and get back in the exercise mode and social scene, then this is your group :)

Please spread the word. The more the better! All are welcome women, men, your friends, (single, married and in between).

Hope to see you soon!

Madeleine

results.description:
We'd like to share experiences building scalable monitoring and alerting solutions using Graphite, Grafana, Collectd, Nagios, Logstash, Elasticsearch and Kibana, among others.

We believe that it is easy to collect metrics from any one system, and to define alerts on single metrics. We already have this capability in place. However, in complex systems, the real operational challenges arise from the way system components interact. Some of these components live inside our data center, some live outside our data center, and all are updating on differing timelines. The functionality and performance of every component has the potential to change every day.

Our challenge is to identify patterns and correlations across multiple systems in our stack. We need to integrate top-down and bottom-up analysis, so we can see, for example, that trial subscription signups (a user metric) fell off at the same time that an internal API call began to fail (an application metric), and it was caused by a database host falling offline (a system metric).

When collecting so much data, there is a risk of being overwhelmed and not being able to make sense of it all. In essence, a risk of collecting data but not producing intelligence. We combat this risk by converting our accumulated data into the most visually information-dense format available: graphs. Then we make graphs easy to compare and easy to share. We make them informative at a glance and easy for the team to keep watching. Finally, once we are regularly identifying patterns across our graphs, we should have an automated way to "watch the graphs" in our absence. It is not an AI or a pattern recognition "black box", it should just automate patterns that humans have first validated to be meaningful.
results.name: Monitoring NYC

results.description:
"Your playing small does not serve the world ... We are all meant to shine."

So when creating this club, I knew I wanted it to be one that empowers and inspires and connects leaders and visionaries in one place. We're mixing a good happy hour, and brunch on a rooftop or other chic venue, with this Amazing Perspective Social Book Club. This club is for new New Yorkers and old New Yorkers looking to transform their perspective on life and the world through inspiring experiences and books. We will read:

• Books you can learn from and apply to your life, and 

• Books that inspire, encourage and challenge you to be your best and do your best: whether that means starting a new business, going back to school, changing careers or being more open to what's around you.

This book club exists to: 

• Read AMAZING books

• Bring together awesome people like you and me & establish genuine connections

• Have good, meaningful conversations about life, our purpose, and our struggles and triumphs while enjoying new experiences and eating at some of the best restaurants in New York City

• Inspire and encourage you  

• Teach you something new and learn more about yourself

• Nourish your soul

Type of book: 

Whether it’s a bio, non-fiction, fiction, or new age, these books will change your life and the way you see the world. It will be reading you can’t put down, that pulls on your heart strings and makes you think about improving your own life, and reading that’s all about personal growth and development. I’ll also take suggestions from our AP Book Socialites, so you’ll have a say as well. 

Here’s how it works: 

• We get 6 weeks to read the book. 

• We meet for Sunday brunch the week we complete the book. Locations will vary throughout Manhattan. During brunch we’ll discuss how the book impacted (or not impacted) your life and how you will incorporate what you’ve learned into your daily practices. 

• We also meet for happy hour and other events throughout the month to break up our work week with some positive, inspiring vibes and good convo. Feel free to suggest venues as well. 

As we explore new parts of ourselves through our reading, let’s explore new restaurants and new parts of the city, and things that bring out the best of us and enrich out lives. The important thing is we live life from an AMAZING Perspective. 

I’m looking forward to connecting, reading and growing with you.

With love, 
Juania
results.name: Amazing Perspective Social Book Club

results.description:
NJ Tech Hardware Startups is a group serving both New Jersey and New York. We look forward to collaborating among entrepreneurs, inventors, Hobbyists, new product development of large companies, engineers, scientists, and others. 

We believe that “…Hardware is the New Software” but is extremely complex and in need of people from almost all market and technology areas. Our hope is to help people accelerate the process, and reduce the risk of moving from Concept to Production and Market. Or, to learn about new ways of designing, prototyping, building and fulfilling tech hardware, software, systems & Components. 

We will be focused on many facets of the Tech Hardware Community including Business (Marketing, Sales, Product Management, Finance, Legal and Operations), Technology, Manufacturing, Positioning, and other facets to bring software integrated hardware systems to market and expansion. 

This is the place to collaborate with and learn from others who are: 

• Considering starting up a Tech Hardware type company, 
• Tinkering around with various technologies to test their ability to solve more problems and increase their effectiveness
 • New to the industry and simply curious about what is possible
 • Trying to figure out how to bring your concept or idea from a concept to a prototype
 • Evaluating manufacturing options for high volume production of your product through either off-Shore or on-Shore or both
 • Assessing the market value and investment options for hardware companies.  

We look to bring to light, discussion, and problem solving of challenges and opportunities of Tech Hardware products and cover the high growth areas of:
• Additive Manufacturing - 3D Printing
• Electronics 
 • Telematics
•  M2M
•  IoT – Internet of Things
 •  Robotics
•  Tech Fashion - including Wearables) 
 •  And what ever you need help with! 

We are bringing all stakeholders in the startup and growth stage business cycle to this group and ensure that companies, looking to manufacture and develop products, are organized for success. You will collaborate with and learn from:
• Angel, VC, Private Equity, and other Investors
• Engineers– all disciplines (i.e. mechanical, software, materials, electrical, textile, etc.)
 • Entrepreneurs
 • Manufacturers and Operations
